thread.title: Fans wear George Michael masks as they pay tribute to singer at Club Tropicana Beach Club
thread.title_full: Fans wear George Michael masks as they pay tribute to singer at Club Tropicana Beach Club

author: Vicki Newman
title: Fans wear George Michael masks as they pay tribute to singer at Club Tropicana Beach Club
text:
Fans wear George Michael masks as they pay tribute to singer at Club Tropicana Beach Club Hundreds of fans went along to a party at the club named after Wham! classic Club Tropicana Share Fans wore George Michael masks to a tribute party at Club Tropicana (Photo: Getty) Share Get celebs   Thank you for subscribing!   
Fans wore George Michael masks as they attended a party night in tribute to the singer. 
London's Tropicana Beach Club opened its doors to fans of the former Wham! star following his tragic death on Christmas Day. 
And in a poignant gesture, the usual £10 door fee was waived and guests instead encouraged to donate as much as they can to one of the musician’s favourite charities. 
But although the song suggests so, it's not sure whether or not the drinks at Club Tropicana actually are free. Read More How many George Michaels can you see? (Photo: Getty) George died on Christmas Day (Photo: PA) 
More than 2,000 people confirmed they’d attend the bash at the club, named after the Wham! classic. 
The public interest in celebrating George’s life was so strong the club had to move the planned party date from a Thursday night to Friday in order to accommodate everyone who wanted to travel to London from elsewhere in the UK. 
A video of the singer, who was found dead in his bed by his partner Fadi Fawaz, was played during the club night, along with a string of his hits. 
As well as George Michael masks, fans also turned up in their swim shorts, ready to enjoy the "fun and sunshine" the hit song promies. The party is in memory of the late star (Photo: Getty) George in his Wham! days (Photo: Rex Features) 
The evening of music and entertainment was in aid of charities including Terrence Higgins Trust, ChildLine and Macmillan Cancer Support. 
An invite for the party read: "As saddened we all are to hear about George Michael’s passing, we want to turn the sadness into a tribute of this extraordinary artist who gave us so much. We invite everyone to come together for a celebratory night and enjoy all of George’s legendary hits and some of his musical influences and songs from the artists he inspired." Read More We wonder if the drinks really are free at Club Tropicana (Photo: Getty) Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
